<Text: The 59th (Staffordshire) Infantry Division
1:
--------------------
Text: 59th (Staffordshire) Infantry Division: The division, after training throughout the United Kingdom for four years from 1940 to 1944, served as part of the 21st Army Group during the early stages of the Battle of Normandy a few weeks after the D-Day landings, which took place on 6 June 1944.

Triplets:<59th (Staffordshire) Infantry Division
2:
--------------------
Text: 59th (Staffordshire) Infantry Division:  Broken up in mid-August, it was one of two divisions of the army group that was disbanded due to a very severe shortage of manpower in the British Army.
